intro: Protium opacum subsp. rabelianum, commonly known as Rabelianum, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland and hill forest habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
